WRITING.TEXT: R.I.P. Issak and his Viktor
Find a channel that's not airing American reality shit? She's as good as dead.

A friend and I were driving through a neighborhood when up ahead we saw a man in his boxers and robe walking out to his mailbox by the edge of the street. As we got closer we noticed he was wearing headphones and totally jamming out. I mean, jumps, kicks, spins, etc. He was so into it that his eyes were closed and he had no idea we were approaching. Just as we start to pass by him, he opens his eyes while mid-air guitar solo. The three of us make eye contact and hold for a moment of pure embarrassment. Realizing he'd been seen the whole time, he gives us the rocker symbol with his hand, sticks out his tongue (a la KISS) and proceeds to rock out. My friend and I thought it was so funny, we joined in as we continued to pass.
Made our day.
Eh, forget the blackjack.

WRITING.TITLE: Boardwalk Empire Episode Discussion S03E09 "The Milkmaid's Lot"
WRITING.TEXT:
20 minutes in, and I still didn't see a discussion thread. Thought I'd start it up.
No spoiler tags needed here, as long as you're discussing something from this episode and back. This is the place to discuss S03E09. Please take a moment to review the subreddit rules to the right. /r/BoardwalkEmpire operates a bit differently than other TV Show subreddits. We encourage discussion as well as original, quality, BWE-related content, therefore there are some restrictions on what is acceptable to post. Please no requests for live streams or torrent links. As someone who is forced to torrent the show myself, I feel your pain, but DL sources are not hard to find. Do you have any ideas or suggestions for this subreddit? Message the moderators and let us know what we can do to make this the best TV show subreddit out there!
I always thought that part was a bit corny.

I kept shouting at the tv for them to stop laughing. If you didn't see that coming, you're blind. And yes, excellent cinematography. I felt the same way about Nucky/Billie's scene right before the explosion. So quiet, and calm.

They were pre-made name tags at the party I attended. It originally said "sexpot" and a friend changed it to "bot" and slapped it on me. I edited it out of another picture (b/c I think it looks better without), but when uploading to imgur I must have picked the wrong one in the thumbnail.

WRITING.TITLE: My Codex (The Guild) costume from last year that I never got around to posting. Enjoy!

WRITING.TEXT: Had a teacher that did the same thing. I walked out of the class and dropped it immediately, then tried to call my family in NY. I sent that teacher a letter a few years ago... Never heard back. But it made me feel better.

Back in HS, I wore a pair of shoes that had purple shoe laces. Actually, they were light purple (lavender). The vice principal stopped me in the hallway and told me that I'd have to remove them because 'they could be gang colors'.
Yes, because we all know how dangerous the Lavender Gang can be.
I told him 'no' and said that it was ridiculous. He called my father who laughed at him and told him the same.
TLDR: In my HS, lavender shoe laces are probably gang colors.

WRITING.TITLE: My opinion on this Pocket Whale thing...

WRITING.TEXT: Skylar's gonna be pissed when she finds out.
[Pocket whales](http://www.quickmeme.com/meme/3r5ljp/)
Gillian. Full crazy. OH GOD. I can see the finale episode...

And what became of Jimmy and Angela's beautiful beach house? I would've assumed Richard or Gillian would have taken it.
And while it's been a year or two since Jimmy's death, I expected Gillian (being ever so close to her son) would be more upset when Jimmy's name is brought up. She has to know that he's dead. He's run off before but this time, she must know, he's dead.

I love how Gyp and Nuck strike a deal at the beginning of the episode. Okay, I guess handling him was easy enough... Then he lights a cop on fire. Well, so much for that. Damn, that guy be crazy. I thought Van Alden was nuts (you just never know what he'll do next) but Rosetti takes the cake!
Psh. Like LaGuerta would bend down in that dress suit to get a piece of evidence blocked by shit covered in ash.
I'm leading toward suspicion as well. Also, I like your name.
I thought she was going to use Gyp to get to Nucky, but Gyp doesn't really need the help, I guess.

Question: Does Gillian really not know how Jimmy died? Or is she just accepting of his fate? Richard obviously knows, and decided that Jimmy knew the game he was playing. So surely Gillian knows, too.

WRITING.TITLE: Nucky Thompson: Keeping the little people in business

WRITING.TEXT: Agreed. Manny was a interesting character and he brought a lot to the overall plot of BE. I was absolutely upset about the things his character had done, but that didn't make him any less interesting. I liked him, and I disliked him, simultaneously. And don't even get me started on Joffrey.

I've enjoyed Manny over the seasons but we all knew Richard would kill him for what he did. I'm sorry to see a great character go, but I'm glad that Harrow is gaining closure. Must have been hard to wait, what, a year and a half? Atta boy, Richard.
Also this.
Part of me is glad that they didn't show this. Van Alden is weird enough. I don't need to see relations with his wife/nanny. Babies are enough proof for me.
